Cherbourg is easily accessible from Normandy and the rest of France and is around 6 h from
St Lazare on a direct train, otherwise there are services to
and to (sometimes) the southwest of France. Be careful: few trains, mainly delayed.
A decent enough network of buses runs round the town, but everything can be reached by foot

is an aquarium situated in the restored trans-Atlantic railway terminal in Cherbourg. Visitors can explore an ocean diving area and a former French Army submarine. The monument was built in 1933 and the museum was opened in 2002.

, 10 Rue Jean Jaurès Octeville (just outside the train station). Basic rooms (shared toilets) and WiFi.

content=The hostel is a member of Hosteling International, so there will be an extra fee for non members (only a few Euros). The minimum age for the hostel is 18; there is no maximum age.
